nodes.text: Mulitlegged throat croakers were a species of parasitic worm that could infect members of the happabore species. Infections of the parasite in happabores could be treated with Happy-Bore Medicated Dewormer, a product produced by Galacti-Stok, which contained Trestibinexocycline 5-Gamma, thlank oil, greel-root acid and forage products. Use of the dewormer on multilegged throat croakers was suggested in the instructions for the product.
Multilegged throat croakers were first mentioned in Rey's Survival Guide, a replica journal written by Jason Fry and released in 2015.
